intent: Build a visual document that feels like a recovered memory from a damaged archive: emotionally legible at first glance, structurally unstable on close inspection, and centered on human trace over pure abstraction.
constraints: Keep one dominant subject silhouette readable in every iteration.
Use artifacting as narrative evidence, not decoration.
Limit palette to 4 core hues plus luminance noise banding.
Include at least one analog-feeling defect per image (scanline wobble, chroma bleed, tape warp).
Preserve 30â€“40% stable geometry for viewer orientation.

researchTrail.title: Glitch art
takeaways: Glitch art includes both accidental malfunction and intentional corruption/manipulation as valid creative methods.
Practices like databending/datamoshing emphasize revealing system internals rather than producing random distortion.
The form has analog and digital lineage, supporting hybrid texture and temporal degradation in one coherent visual language.
Its documented discourse (symposia/festivals) frames glitch as cultural critique, not merely an aesthetic filter.

inspiration: Transit maps overprinted on rain-soaked windows
OCR ghosts from multilingual street posters

iterations.label: Witness Frame
iterations.summary: Established readable subject and mild codec fracture.

iterations.label: Signal Drift
iterations.summary: Added temporal smear, channel offsets, and fragmented caption substrate.

iterations.label: Archive Stress Test
iterations.summary: Pushed databend intensity while preserving focal contour.

iterations.label: Human Anchor Pass
iterations.summary: Reduced noise around semantic anchors for readability.

selfCritique: I overuse midtone texture density, which can flatten narrative hierarchy. Best results occur when I protect one emotional anchor and let instability orbit it. Next cycle should enforce stronger negative space and place heavy corruption only at meaning-bearing transitions.

finalOutput.rationale: Chosen for best balance of experimentation and legibility: one documentary anchor remains clear while surrounding artifacts imply memory failure rather than decorative noise.
